Title: Too much of a good thing: How unchecked dietary supplements turn toxic, lure many to early grave
Summary: A relentless quest for beauty and wellness, marked by the desire for flawless skin and strong immunity, has fuelled a craze among Nigerians for consuming a wide range of dietary supplements .

Title: 2027: Tinubu rallies governors to performance, lures North with slots
Summary: President Bola Tinubu charged governors elected on platform of the party to redouble their commitment to development, especially security, and grassroots mobilisation . He stressed the imperative of leaving behind a legacy of progressive governance .

Title: ADC, CUPP kick as Tinubu labels opposition ‘coalition of confusion’
Summary: The African Democratic Congress (ADC) has accused President Bola Tinubu and the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) of displaying intolerance towards opposition parties . The party says the APC appears unsettled by the ADC’s growing influence .

Title: Oba Sikiru Kayọde Adetọna (1934-2025)
Summary: Oba Sikiru Kayode Adetona, the Awujale of Ijebuland, passed away on July 13, 2025, after 65 years on the throne . The passing marked the end of one of the longest monarchical reigns in the country .

Title: PDP NEC approves November convention, hopeful of defectors’ return
Summary: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) resolved to hold its Elective National Convention from November 15 to 16, 2025, in Ibadan, Oyo State . The convention is part of efforts to reposition the party ahead of the 2027 general elections .

Title: Banks, insurance, others contribute N1.77trn to economy in Q1’25
Summary: Banks, insurance, others contribute N1.77trn to economy in first quarter of the year, Q1 ’25, representing 15 per cent, year-on-year YoY, increase from N.545trn in Q1’24 . The National Bureau of Statistics, NBS disclosed this in its report

Title: Dangote Cargo: Nigerian ships lose to Angola’s fleet
Summary: Dangote Refinery has turned to Angola’s fleet for shipment of its crude and refined products . President of the African Shipowners Association in Nigeria, Ladi Olubowale, made the revelation at the 2025 Maritime Law Seminar in Lagos .

Title: 2027: ‘Coalition of confusion’ – Tinubu mocks ADC as Yilwatda emerges APC chair
Summary: Bola Tinubu took a swipe at the coalition-backed African Democratic Congress, ADC, describing it as a “coalition of confusion” The President described the ADC as a coalition of confusion .

Title: Plane crashes in Russia, kills 50 passengers
Summary: Plane carrying nearly 50 people crashed in remote area of Russia’s far eastern Amur region . Soviet-made twin-propeller Antonov-24 went down in thickly forested terrain, leaving a column of smoke rising from the crash site .

Title: Stop poking your nose in opposition affairs, Atiku fires back at Tinubu, APC
Summary: Atiku Abubakar has criticised President Bola Tinubu and the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) for allegedly interfering in the affairs of opposition parties . The former Vice President said the ruling party should not interfere in opposition parties' affairs .

Title: JUST IN: Emir of Gusau dies at 71
Summary: The Emir of Gusau in Zamfara State, Dr. Ibrahim Bello, passed on at the age of 71 after a protracted illness . The 16th Emir succeeded his father who died on March 16, 2015 . He was a civil servant who rose to the highest position of Permanent Secretary during his service in old Sokoto and Zam

Title: Okomu Oil declares ₦30 interim dividend
Summary: Okomu Oil Palm Company has proposed ₦30 per 50 kobo ordinary share as interim dividend for the period ended 30 June 2025 . This is revealed in a corporate disclosure filed with the Nigerian Exchange Ltd. on Thursday . The Register of Shareholders will be closed from August 11 to 15 .

Title: FG moves to repatriate stranded Nigerians in Central African Republic
Summary: The Federal Government has commenced efforts to rescue and repatriate a group of Nigerian workers stranded in the Central African Republic . This was following a viral video showing the distressed individuals abandoned in the Bambari region, about 850km from the country’s capital, Bangui . Title: Man arrested for killing ex-wife in Jigawa
Summary: The Jigawa State Police Command has arrested two suspects in connection with murder and armed robbery cases in different parts of the state . The first suspect, Iliyasu Musa, a 40-year-old man from Dangewaye Village, Aujara District, was arrested for allegedly killing his ex-wife, Had

Title: Schools charged to produce tech-driven leaders
Summary: The University of Technology and Technology in Lagos, Nigeria, was founded in 2010 . It aims to develop the next generation of leaders equipped to solve real-world problems using innovation and leadership .
